channel.title: Javascript on Mesh Studio
channel.description: Recent content in Javascript on Mesh Studio

item.title: React Native Navigation
item.description: React Native Navigation From Native to Cross-Platform React Native navigation code can seem very odd to developers coming from Objective C or Swift. Whereas native code asks that developers subclass Navigation and Tab Bar controllers, React Native demands that app navigation must be scaffolded in a single constructor. This seemed more than a little odd when I first started doing React Native development. I was also frustrated to find that React Native’s documentation doesn’t really provide much guidance beyond the ‘Hello World’ set up.

item.title: Writing Better Components in Vue.js
item.description: Pros and Cons of Vue.js When starting a new project, you want to get things up and running as quickly as possible. While modern JavaScript advancements have made things a lot easier on developers, they have also increased the complexity of getting things going. Every developer who has worked with Webpack knows what I am talking about; Webpack is a great example of a very powerful tool that has an incredibly steep learning curve, even for doing basic things.
